question_sentence: Canada expelled which country's ambassador as part of an escalating diplomatic feud between the two nations?
evidence: Ottawa announced that it was expelling six Indian diplomats after discovering evidence linking the fatal shooting of a Sikh separatist in British Columbia last year to Indian intelligence services. India, which denies the allegations, responded by asking Canada's acting ambassador and five other officials to leave the country.

question_sentence: What was found in a Viking-era site discovered by archaeologists in Denmark?
evidence: Fifty skeletons were discovered in a burial ground near the village of Åsum, believed to date back to the Viking era. The remains may help scientists unravel some of the mysteries surrounding Viking DNA.

question_sentence: England's new men's football coach, German Thomas Tuchel, said he plans to learn what before taking up the role in January?
evidence: Tuchel, whose appointment has caused consternation among some commentators, said he would "absolutely start learning" the words to "God Save the King". However, he stopped short of promising to sing it at matches, saying he would "take a little bit of time for this decision".

question_sentence: Nasa's Europa Clipper spacecraft has launched, headed towards which planet?
evidence: Nasa's largest extraplanetary spacecraft launched from Florida's Kennedy Space Center on Monday. It will travel 1.8 billion miles over more than five years to reach Jupiter, where it will study an ocean believed to lie 10 to 15 miles beneath the icy surface of Jupiter's moon, Europa.

question_sentence: Which controversial fashion event returned to the catwalk after a five-year hiatus – to decidedly mixed reviews?
evidence: The runway show was back at the brand's flagship store in New York on Tuesday, after it was pulled in 2019 following toxic workplace allegations during the #MeToo era. But the much-vaunted revamp was a "far cry from the event's heyday", said the Daily Mail.

question_sentence: What did the Biden administration warn Israel it must do to continue receiving US military aid?
evidence: The Biden administration warned Israel that US military aid could be at risk unless Israel permits at least 350 aid trucks a day into Gaza, ensuring increased deliveries of food, medicine and humanitarian aid within 30 days. An Israeli official confirmed the ultimatum is "being thoroughly reviewed".

question_sentence: Afghanistan's Taliban government has announced a ban on what, putting media freedom in peril?
evidence: State media outlets in the provinces of Kandahar, Takhar and Maidan Wardak have been "advised" not to show photos or videos of "anything with a soul", due to the Taliban's severe interpretation of sharia law. A Taliban spokesperson said the advice to journalists was currently only "guidance".

question_sentence: Why did a Georgia judge block a new rule requiring three workers to hand-count every ballot cast on US election day?
evidence: Fulton County Superior Court Judge Robert McBurney said the rule, passed on 20 September, was "too much, too late". With early voting already under way in Georgia, there wasn't enough time to guide, train or hire the necessary workers for every precinct.

question_sentence: A new bill under consideration by the UK Parliament opens the door to legalising what?
evidence: MPs will get a vote on Labour MP Kim Leadbeater's private members' bill to permit assisted dying for terminally ill people in England and Wales at a second reading next month. When the subject was last considered in 2015, members voted 330 to 118 against legalising assisted dying, but recent polls show the public is overwhelmingly in favour.

question_sentence: Briton Adriana Brownlee has become the youngest woman to climb the world's 14 highest mountain peaks, at what age?
evidence: Adriana Brownlee became the youngest woman to climb 14 of the world's highest mountain peaks after reaching the 8,027-metre summit of Shishapangma in Tibet. She is the second person from Britain to have achieved this feat.

question_sentence: What do Southbridge residents blame for the recent building collapse in Wilmington’s Southbridge neighborhood?
What organization sponsored the emergency airlift that brought nearly 100 shelter animals from Florida to the Brandywine Valley SPCA after Hurricane Milton?
What is the primary purpose of the redevelopment of the Bank of America building in Wilmington as detailed in the Community Education Building memo?
choices: To establish a new financial center
To develop a community education space
To convert it into a shopping mall

question_sentence: Who is eligible to receive free potassium iodide tablets in Delaware?
choices: Residents living within a 10-mile radius of the Salem and Hope Creek nuclear generating stations
Residents living within a 50-mile radius of the Salem and Hope Creek nuclear generating stations

question_sentence: What subject does Shelby Borst, the 2025 Delaware Teacher of the Year, teach at William Penn High School?
As of the latest update, to whom does Wilmington’s residency law apply?
Which Wilmington location did Aubrey Plaza describe as “one of the most iconic Wilmington landmarks”?
What was Michael Kealty, the former Smyrna police detective, charged with in federal court?
choices: Coercion and enticement of a minor

question_sentence: Why has the Delaware State Fire Marshal implemented a burn ban?
What was the main focus of the Migratory Bird Day event at Brandywine Zoo?
choices: Raising funds for new zoo exhibits
Introducing new bird species to the zoo
Educating people about the importance of insects and birds

question_sentence: NASA launched a mission this week to investigate a potentially habitable ocean world. Where is the spacecraft headed?
evidence: NASA’s Europa Clipper, designed to explore Jupiter’s moon Europa, launched on Monday. The spacecraft aims to determine whether the moon could be habitable for life as we know it.

question_sentence: Which climate pattern is expected to develop ahead of winter and affect temperatures, precipitation and snow across the US?
evidence: A La Niña winter is coming. If it ends up rather weak, winter is expected to be warmer than normal across almost the entire southern half of the US and much of the East.

question_sentence: Which two battleground states kicked off early in-person voting this week?
evidence: Early voting began in Georgia and North Carolina as former President Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris race to make their pitches to voters. Georgia is already seeing a record turnout.

question_sentence: Which type of drink was recalled by Coca-Cola this week after thousands of cases were mislabeled as "zero sugar?”
evidence: Around 13,000 cases of Minute Maid Lemonade were recalled by Coca-Cola because they were mislabeled as "zero sugar." The cartons actually contained the full-sugar version of the drink, according to a report from the FDA.

question_sentence: Pop star Liam Payne’s tragic death this week left fans and the music industry reeling. Which boyband was he a part of?
evidence: Liam Payne, who was 31, rocketed to global stardom in 2010 as a member of the boyband One Direction. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of his death after a reported hotel balcony fall.

question_sentence: Which airline was recently fined a record $4 million for civil rights violations?
evidence: Lufthansa, Germany's biggest airline, was fined a record $4 million for denying 128 Jewish passengers from boarding as a group — even though the passengers did not know each other nor were they traveling together.

question_sentence: Seven-time Super Bowl champion Tom Brady recently became a part owner of which NFL team?
evidence: Tom Brady has joined the ranks of NFL team owners after he purchased a minority share of the Las Vegas Raiders, the NFL announced this week.

question_sentence: Which country celebrated Thanksgiving this week?
evidence: Though the US version of Thanksgiving takes place on the fourth Thursday of November, Canada celebrates the fall harvest on the second Monday of October, which this year fell on October 14.

question_sentence: The closest supermoon of the year loomed large and bright in the sky this week. What was its name?
evidence: October's supermoon — the hunter’s moon — was the biggest, brightest supermoon of the year. The lunar event marked the changing of the seasons.

question_sentence: The Victoria's Secret Fashion Show returned this week after a six-year hiatus. Where did the show take place?
evidence: The Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show returned to New York. The show featured a lineup of all-women musical talent and runway appearances from brand veterans and new faces.
